did.unittitle: William Eno and the Eno Foundation
did.abstract: This collection includes materials from newspaper articles about William Eno and his work. It also has correspondence from the Eno Foundation files and a book published by the foundation.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: William Phelps Eno was a wealthy Westport summer resident who gave up in real estate at age 41 to devote full time to traffic reform. At the time he began in 1889, there were no written traffic regulations and traffic regulations and traffic in cities everywhere was chaotic. He became the world's foremost authority on traffic reform. His rules were translated into many languages. In 1921, he established the Eno Foundation for Transportation which since his death has carried on his mission.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The first series entitled William Eno covers magazine and newspaper articles about him from 1915 and 1996. The second series entitled the Eno Foundation contains the book entitled Eno the Man and the Foundation published by the Eno Foundation in 1988 with an article from the Westport News about the foundation the same year.
